title: Fundamental difference in coaching philosophy at youth level is the secret to the All Blacks' genius
text:
In New Zealand, so I am told, you grow up with a rugby ball in your hands. If you are walking down the street or hanging outside a bus station, you are throwing passes to your mates.

When kids are in PE at school, it is the same story. They play touch rugby. On the other hand, in England, the opportunity to have fun is framed around football. I get that. It’s our culture.

Even at Premiership clubs, trust me, coaches will attempt to lighten the mood at training every now and then by bringing out a football. And everyone loves it.
